byline.contributor: Maher Sattar reported from Dhaka, and Geeta Anand from New Delhi. Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka.
byline.original: By MAHER SATTAR and GEETA ANAND

abstract: Tahmid Hasib Khan, University of Toronto student who was held hostage in Dhaka restaurant attack claimed by Islamic State, is being detained by Bangladeshi police on suspicion of participation in episode; Khan's family and friends say it is case of mistaken identity.
lead_paragraph: Tahmid Khan, a college student, was wrongly suspected of being in league with the militants, his family and friends say. They now fear for his safety.

headline.main: Man Survives Terrorist Attack in Bangladesh, but Is in Custody as a Suspect
headline.print_headline: Hostage of Terrorists Is Now Held by the Police

snippet: Tahmid Khan, a college student, was wrongly suspected of being in league with the militants, his family and friends say. They now fear for his safety....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
